Class DynamicPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • org.youscope.uielements.DynamicPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FocusField, LiveStreamPanel.ChannelControl, PropertyEditorAdapter, SingleComponentDefinitionPanel, SubConfigurationPanel

    public class DynamicPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    A panel simplifying with a grid bag layout simplifying to handle it.
    Author:
    Moritz Lang
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • CONSTRAINT_NEW_LINE

        public static final java.awt.GridBagConstraints CONSTRAINT_NEW_LINE
        Standard constraints used when adding an element without arguments. The element fills the line, and the next element will be placed below.

      • CONSTRAINT_CENTER

        public static final java.awt.GridBagConstraints CONSTRAINT_CENTER
        The element will be centered at the line, and the next element will be placed below.

      • add

        public java.awt.Component add(java.awt.Component component,
                              java.awt.GridBagConstraints constraint)
        Adds a component, setting the grid bag layout to the given constraints.
        Parameters:
        component - The component to add.
        constraint - The constraints to set the layout to before adding.
        Returns:
        the added component.

      • add

        public java.awt.Component add(java.awt.Component component,
                              int index,
                              java.awt.GridBagConstraints constraint)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                              java.lang.NullPointerException
        Adds a component at a specific position, setting the grid bag layout to the given constraints.
        Parameters:
        component - The component to add.
        index - Index where to add component. Must be greater or equal 0 and smaller than Container.getComponentCount()
        constraint - The constraints to set the layout to before adding.
        Returns:
        the added component.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if index is invalid
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if comp is null
